intro: Pterichis vasquezii, commonly known as the Vásquez's pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs. Pterichis vasquezii is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
